body: While the crash you're seeing is due to you building alacritty in debug mode(debug flag on rust packages is to build without opitimizations). The issue is that your font height is just `1`, so even if it'll work for you it means that you won't see font anyway...

body: We do multiply, etc. I also use freetype 2.12.1 and don't have any issues. Try different font.
I have tried. There are some problem with Source Code Pro font.
Try updating your font, I think that one had issues with svg's in it.

The [OT-SVG support](https://freetype.org/freetype2/docs/reference/ft2-svg_fonts.html) is new to FreeType and relies on external SVG libraries, which you might be missing. Setting this up is not trivial. I suggest asking on freetype@nongnu.org. If you really need it. Even if you want a more graceful fallback, other than size 1, you should ask or make suggestion there.

@apodtele Can't we opt-out from OT-SVG thing? We don't use it and it's optional from what I can see why it started to break random fonts? Do we have to say freetype that we don't support that?

I mean rendering SVG's is not an issue, especially with rust infra, the problem is that we don't support them now and all old versions won't support them as well meaning that freetype did a breaking change? Like old alacritty won't work anymore if freetype built with svg support?

That all looks like a freetype bug to me, since you do a minor bump breaking fonts for all old clients.

The problem is not that we can use `librsvg` to handle `OT-SVG` with freetype, the problem is that all old versions of alacritty can't do that, since only new one get a patch. I'd guess we're not the only application affected by that.

Affected by what? So far we have not received any coherent bug reports or a problem description. We would appreciate a comparison between the old and and new behaviors that annoys you so much, or something that would qualify as a regression.
@kchibisov I find an [old issue](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/6048) about similar problem.

That font is [SanSourceCodePro-Regular version 2.030](https://github.com/adobe-fonts/source-code-pro/releases/tag/2.030R-ro%2F1.050R-it). It contains an SVG table. Is that correct? It shows Ok in [ftview](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/freetype/freetype-demos) with current FreeType master.  A few fails, I assume, come from SVG, which I do not have on Windows.

What you mean by "uses height 1"? Which FreeType API returns that? I would really appreciate if you filed an issue with FreeType with that information. Keep in mind that this might have been fixed [already](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/freetype/freetype/-/commits/master?search=SVG).
@apodtele It seems like our issue was that we assumed that colored fonts are not scalable, but this one is colored scalable font. At least freetype tells us that this font has color.
